title: Get Message Status

The time the message was sent, in Unix milliseconds.
If the message has been acknowledged by the channel.
The time the message was acknowledged, in Unix milliseconds.
If the message has been delivered to the recipient.
The time the message was delivered, in Unix milliseconds.
If the message has been read by the recipient.
The time the message was read, in Unix milliseconds.
The time the message was created, in Unix milliseconds.
The time the message was updated, in Unix milliseconds.

title: Send Message via WhatsApp
name: SendMessage_WhatsApp
description:
Send a message to the specified phone number via a WhatsApp channel.

The phone number must be registered in WhatsApp.

If parameter withCase is true, the message will always be sent to an open case. If the user already has an open case, the message will be sent to that case. Otherwise, a new case will be created for the user.

If parameter topicID is not specified and new case should be created, then the channel's first topic will be used as default.

Parameter.description: The phone number to send the message to.
The message body (text message or file URL).
The name of the file (required for message type other than "text").
If true, the message will be sent to the recipient's existing open case or a new case will be created.

Success 200.description: The ID of the case which the message was sent to.

examples.title: Success Response:

Error 4xx.description: The feature is not available due to the organization's current tier.
The organization has not selected a tier.

title: Send Templated Message via WhatsApp Business API
name: SendTemplatedMessage_WhatsAppBA
description:
Send a templated message to the specified phone number via a WhatsApp Business API channel.

The phone number must be registered in WhatsApp.

If parameter withCase is true, the message will always be sent to an open case. If the user already has an open case, the message will be sent to that case. Otherwise, a new case will be created for the user.

If parameter topicID is not specified and new case should be created, then the channel's first topic will be used as default.

Parameter.description: The phone number ID to send the message from (required if vendor is "meta").
The phone number to send the message to.
The language code of the message template.
If true, the message will be sent to the recipient's existing open case or a new case will be created.

Success 200.description: The ID of the case which the message was sent to.

examples.title: Success Response:

Error 4xx.description: The feature is not available due to the organization's current tier.

title: Office Hours - Get
name: OfficeHours_Get
description:
Get the organization's list of office hours.

Day of Week Description
10 Sunday
11 Monday
12 Tuesday
13 Wednesday
14 Thursday
15 Friday
16 Saturday
90 Everyday
91 Weekdays (Monday until Friday)
92 Weekends (Saturday and Sunday)

The time format is "HH:mm", in 24-hours format.

Success 200.description: The list of all active office hours.
The day of week, see description above.
The time the record was created, in Unix milliseconds.
The time the record was last updated, in Unix milliseconds.

examples.title: FeatureNotAvailable:

title: Topic - Add Agents
name: Topic_AddAgents
description:
Add agents to a topic.

Each customer organization can have maximum number of agents based on its registered tier. The maximum number of agents is calculated distinctly by account from all existing topics. For example, if an agent is assigned to more than 1 topic, it counts as 1 agent.

Parameter.description: Email addresses of the accounts to be added as the topic's agent.

Success 200.description: Email addresses of the agents successfully added to the topic.

Error 4xx.description: The feature is not available due to the organization's current tier.
The organization's maximum number of agents has been reached.
The organization has not selected a tier.

title: Request Auth Ticket
name: RequestAuthTicket
description:
Request auth ticket for Live Chat on behalf of the specified user/contact, passing along the user's data to be saved to contacts. The auth ticket can be used to request an access token for Live Chat. An auth ticket is valid for 1 hour before it expires.

See User API - Sync Contact for explanation on user/contact sync.

Success 200.description: The auth ticket to request an access token.

Error 4xx.description: The organization has not selected a tier.
The feature is not available due to the organization's current tier.

examples.title: ParamValidationFailed:
FeatureNotAvailable:

Parameter.description: The user's phone, must start with country code.

title: Sync Contact
name: SyncContact
description:
Sync a user from customer's server to OneTalk contacts.

The sync process will check for existing contacts using all the following keys:

  • customerUserID (required)
  • phone (optional)

If no contact is found, a new contact will be created. If exactly one contact is found using the sync keys, the contact will be updated. If more than one contacts are found, the sync will be rejected because duplicate keys are not allowed.

Customer user ID can't be changed for existing contacts. So, if the existing contact is already tied to a different customer user ID, the sync will be rejected. However, if the existing contact is not tied to any customer user ID yet, it will be updated to the specified customerUserID.

Error 4xx.description: The organization has not selected a tier.
The feature is not available due to the organization's current tier.

examples.title: ParamValidationFailed:
FeatureNotAvailable:

Parameter.description: The user's phone, must start with country code.
